titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pauline Park Papers TAM.663
titlestmt.author: Caroline Evans

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-11-30 14:34:04 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 16 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize flat box, and 1 oversize folder in shared housing

did.abstract: The Pauline Park Papers contains material from 1986-2015 documenting the advocacy, activism, and writing of Pauline Park, a transgender activist, speaker, writer, and educator. A large portion of the collection contains material from the New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy (NYAGRA) and Queens Pride House (QPH) two organizations that Park helped co-found, in 1998 and 1997, respectively, and lead. Park campaigned for the transgender rights law enacted by the New York City Council in 2002, and in 2005 became the first openly transgender grand marshal of the New York City Pride March. Park has been the keynote speaker at many LGBT and Asian American conferences and events held in the United States. She has written extensively about arts and culture, music, spirituality, politics, theatre, race, and LGBT health and rights. Her writing has been published in journals, newspapers, and newsletters. This collection contains materials on subjects such as transgender health, identity, community, and public policy, and includes correspondence, board meeting minutes, photographs, VHS tapes, conference name badges, certificates, audio recordings, original poetry and creative writing, notes, speeches, flyers and programs for events and conferences related to QPH and NYAGRA, press featuring Park, and letters to politicians and allied organizations advocating the passage of LGTBQ inclusion and non-discrimination legislation.
did.langmaterial: The majority of materials are in English, with a limited number of materials in Korean.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Pauline Park in 2015. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2015.004, 2015.055, and 2015.059.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into four series. The collection is arranged into groupings by subject matter that reflect the original order in which the collection was donated to the Tamiment Library. The arrangement is as follows:
II. Writings, Publications, and Other Related Creative Projects, 1997-2014

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pauline Park (1960- ) is an transgender activist based in New York City who received her PhD in Political Science from the University of Illinois. She is the President of the Board of Directors and Acting Executive Director of Queens Pride House (QPH) and Chair of the New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy (NYAGRA). Park led the campaign for the transgender rights law enacted by the New York City Council in 2002, and in 2005 became the first openly transgender grand marshal of the New York City Pride March. Pauline has written widely on LGBTQ issues and has conducted transgender sensitivity training sessions for a wide range of organizations. She was the subject of the 2008 documentary Envisioning Justice: The Journey of a Transgendered Woman. Park was named to Huffington Post's list of "The Most Influential LGBT Asian Icons" and to a list of "50 Transgender Icons" on the Transgender Day of Remembrance in 2012.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Pauline Park Papers; TAM 663; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused into new acid-free folders and boxes, with original folder titles transcribed. The original order of the collection as maintained by Pauline Park has been retained, with the exception of audiovisual and oversize items which were removed and rehoused in appropriate size boxes. Box-level descriptions were created by an archivist based on the contents of each box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to the advocacy, activism, and writing of Pauline Park from 1986 to 2015. The bulk of the material in this collection comes from the early 1990s until the mid 2010s and documents Park's work as co-founder and co-leader of the New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy, the first New York statewide transgender advocacy organization, and Queens Pride House, the LGBT community center of Queens, New York. The collection contains some of Park's published and unpublished writing which addresses topics of transgender health, identity, community, and public policy as well as race, national identity, philosophy, spirituality, and the arts. Materials in the collection include correspondence, programs, digital images, photographs, VHS and audio cassette tapes, conference name badges, certificates, audio recordings, original poetry and creative writing, flyers for events and conferences related to Queens Pride House (QPH) and the New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy (NYAGRA), press clippings and magazine articles featuring Park, and letters to politicians and allied organizations advocating the passage of LGTBQ non-discrimination legislation.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Pauline Park, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These materials were solicited by Laura Chen Schulz Deputy Director of New York University's Asian/Pacific/American Institute and Tim Naftali, Tamiment Director and shipped direct to Tamiment by Pauline Park. Initially, five boxes were donated to Tamiment on January 25, 2015 which comprised the 2015.004 accession. The rest of the boxes were received from Pauline Park on unknown dates in 2015.

controlaccess.subject: Political activists -- United States.
Transgender people.
Gender discrimination.
controlaccess.corpname: New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is grouped by organization, then arranged alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material in this series largely contains material from Pauline Park's work with the New York Association for Gender Rights Advocacy and Queens Pride House from the 1900s to the mid 2010s. There is some material from other LGBT and Asian American organizations as well. Material in this series includes: board meeting minutes, audio recordings, notes, correspondence between Park and NYAGRA/QPH members, certificates of incorporation, grant proposals and reports, flyers, press, information packets, and brochures. This series contains audiovisual material.

Writings, Publications, and Other Related Creative Projects

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is grouped by title, then arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains published and unpublished creative, critical, academic, and personal written material by Park from the late 1990s to the mid 2010s. The material in this series includes drafts of personal essays, articles published in LGBT magazines, VHS tapes, published letters to newspaper editors, book chapters, poetry, a play script, and an audio recording of Park playing the piano. This series contains born-digital and audiovisual materials.

did.unittitle: Iban/Queer Koreans of New York Press
Iban/Queer Koreans of New York Publications
News Magazines (PersuAsian, Gay Asian and Pacific Islander Men of New York)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material in this series is grouped by file title, then arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains ephemera from the many events where Park was a speaker, panelist moderator, participant, or attendee. The bulk of the material from this series comes from 1997-2014. Of note in this series are flyers, programs, and press from 2005 when Park was the first openly transgender marshall in the New York City Pride March and name badges from events that Park participated in. Ephemera from this series include: flyers, programs, brochures, speaking contracts, speeches, digital images, photographs, testimony from court cases, correspondence, and legal notices from court cases. This series contains born-digital material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is grouped by file title, then arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series mostly contains interviews with, and documentaries about, Pauline Park. Material in this series includes: VHS tape recordings of interviews, publications, correspondence, award plaques and program, and press.
